TopicTitle: [1.3] The Plugin Workshop - Small plugins of varied function

Articles.Content:
Just wanted to let you know that by request the mod ModActions now supports the optional momentum discharge thruster functionality included with RW saturatable.   

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116142-122dec3116-modactions-control-your-vessel-including-other-mods-via-actiongroups/&do=embed&comment=2906806&embedComment=2906806&embedDo=findComment"></iframe>

EDIT: Pinging [@Crzyrndm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/92871-crzyrndm/) in case you want to include a link in the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr>.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-01-02T21:55:44Z" title="01/02/2017 09:55  PM" data-short="7 yr">January 2, 2017</time> by Errol**

> 
> 
> On ‎10‎/‎15‎/‎2016 at 0:44 AM, Crzyrndm said:
> 
> 
> All listed mods updated for KSP 1.2.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I will not be updating Analog Control or Thermal Monitor as I no longer find myself using them.
> 

I am ignorant as to what kind of differences exist between KSP v1.2 and v1.2.2 (I run the latter.)  Would it be possible to add a .version file to the zipfile to better illuminate this?  I'm led to understand that this would also assist with AVC and <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> versioning efforts, as well.

> 
> 
> 47 minutes ago, MisterFister said:
> 
> 
> I am ignorant as to what kind of differences exist between KSP v1.2 and v1.2.2 (I run the latter.)
> 

In a general sense their impact:  KSP 1.2 was a major mod-breaking change.  KSP 1.2.1 was a minor mod-breaking change.  KSP 1.2.2 was a bugfix release only and anything for 1.2.1 has a very very high likelihood of working on 1.2.2.

And what of adding a .version file to the download package?

**Edited <time datetime="2017-01-06T07:40:27Z" title="01/06/2017 07:40  AM" data-short="7 yr">January 6, 2017</time> by MisterFister**

Does this mod increase deflection speed of control surfaces?  I.e. if I center joystick it takes a second for control surfaces to return to neutral position, and thus feels a bit sluggish.  Trying to find something that will gives me some Blue Angel snappy responsiveness ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

[@Crzyrndm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/92871-crzyrndm/)

Hey did you ever get discharge torque working? I still would love to see forces applied to the craft to de-spin RWs instead of the abstracted momentum discharge thruster.

[@Crzyrndm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/92871-crzyrndm/) I'm having an issue with Dynamic Deflection + Pilot Assistant inverting roll inputs.  

Things I'm sure of:

- uninstalling Dynamic Deflection got rid of it
- I first noticed it just after take-off when activating Pilot Assistant heading control
- when testing to see what had happened I realised it was affecting manual input as well as autopilot (Q banked right etc ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:"))
- It didn't affect pitch or yaw
- It affected mored than 1 craft, including stock (Mallard)

I've uninstalled DD for now to avoid trouble, but a fix or some advice would be gratefully recieved ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
>

> - when testing to see what had happened I realised it was affecting manual input as well as autopilot (Q banked right etc ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:"))
> - It didn't affect pitch or yaw
> - It affected mored than 1 craft, including stock (Mallard)

That's weird, there used to be a similar bug but it was fixed. I think right before 1.2.2 came out. Maybe something changed in how the stock modules handled deflection ranges?

I've done worse. Probably will again. Recently I worked on a set of fixes for MechJeb. Nothing big, but there were multiple small fixes for the same thing all over. And somehow, one file didn't get committed so when I did the pull request, only half the fix was actually there. And then I accidentally discarded the changed file in Github. So I had to decompile my dll to remind myself of everything I'd changed. I littered the <abbr title="Mechjeb (mod)">MJ</abbr> repository with like three pull requests ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

call me stupid... but if i turn OFF "magical" decay, and turn the txt into .cfg... that makes realistic RWs? or am i misunderstanding?

ok... actually, all of these look like something i'm (sortof) looking for... but im not sure if i understand any of them properly based on whats here... im not good with numbers (innumerate other than counting and spotting patterns), so if someone could give me an einstein "5 year-old" explanation?

[@argentrolf](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/177905-argentrolf/)

I would not describe it as realistic ever. This is a far too simplistic model for that. But essentially yes, if you make those two changes you can only regain RW power by either unwinding, or discharging resources

All plugins have now been rebuilt for KSP 1.3
cool, i might try that out... as for calling it realistic... this is kerbin!

Hi there, i like the idea of the dynamic deflection, but in my imagination, shouldnt the stock "Authority Limiter" be affected? I'm not using <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr>, thus StockModule is used, and thus-thus changing controlSurface.ctrlSurfaceRange means what? I "think" i saw some <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> overshooting, and stuff like stock <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> or Mechjebs SmartASS would love to see stock values being changed, to account that for their controllers. Or is it just not updating the ingame UI?

EDIT: could you use [authorityLimiter](https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/api/class_module_control_surface.html#abec5027232ce0d0c7f56e66087c397e7) instead of [ctrlSurfaceRange](https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/api/class_module_control_surface.html#a48789d1f9f670fbf9932aa8a8e2c8b67)? And i just tested playing around with the % Deflect values at 0 and 40kPa, and nothing really changed. 1.3 btw.

EDIT2: forked it, need to get VS17 to compile that case ... when stuff... :-)

![VT1CjXd.png](https://i.imgur.com/VT1CjXd.png)

EDIT3: love it ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D"); if you like it [@Crzyrndm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/92871-crzyrndm/), i can PR it. Anyone else, the DLL and Defaults.cfg you need for that change is on my fork: [https://github.com/blackliner/DynamicControls](https://github.com/blackliner/DynamicControls)

![1dBQbvt.png](https://i.imgur.com/1dBQbvt.png), 

![7xMBstR.png](https://i.imgur.com/7xMBstR.png)

Those changes are not required for either the stock <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> or MechJeb to see the changes that Dynamic Deflection makes. They see the changes just fine. And how much control does your changes exert over the authority limiter? I, the player, still needs to be able to use that slider. That's for me to use as the End User.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Starwaster said:
> 
> 
> Those changes are not required for either the stock <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> or MechJeb to see the changes that Dynamic Deflection makes. They see the changes just fine. And how much control does your changes exert over the authority limiter? I, the player, still needs to be able to use that slider. That's for me to use as the End User.
> 

I guess you're right about the <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr>'es, but changing the authority limiter gives you a visual feedback. I always was unsure if the mod actually worked, and it seems you can't change the table inflight (maybe that was the problem all along). 

I don't understand your question, all I did was changing from altering the ctrlsurfacerange (in degree) to altering the authoritylimiter property (percentage) to have a visual representation.

- If you can't change settings in flight, that's a bug
- As [@Starwaster](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/71262-starwaster/) mentions, the reason for the choice of field was in order to work side by side with the user control (as this is the only stock control for deflection angles, I don't want to remove that option)

Modifying the settings in flight is the same as in the editor (Place mouse over the control surface and press 'K'). In the flight window, there is also a readout showing the current control percentage, Dynamic Pressure (Q), and a simple graph plotting the input points and the current output (dropdown at the bottom of window)

As far as observing that it's working, my favourite used to be an Aeris 3A (with a whiplash for ease of use)going full throttle and just watching stock <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> shake itself to pieces above ~200m/s. Happy to say that is no longer an issue (well, until you hit ~1000m/s at sea level...) but with that gone and stock still being rather difficult to disintergrate by pulling up too hard, it does make the effect of DD much less compelling.

It's main use now is for <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> (preventing those "oops I pulled up too hard" moments for keyboard players), and making life easier for flight control mods (I basically expect anyone using Pilot Assistant to also use this. It was originally a sub component of PA, I pulled it out as a standalone because it had many uses)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-12T19:41:01Z" title="06/12/2017 07:41  PM" data-short="7 yr">June 12, 2017</time> by Gordon Dry**

The fix is still in place this time ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif ":blush:")

Test without it to be sure that it is DD (most likely. Not much else fiddles in the same manner...), and a vessel for testing that can reliably reproduce this would be **very** helpful

So now I just started a sandbox game to test a downloaded aircraft that is made with KSP 1.3 and uses only stock and Airplane Plus parts.

As soon as it's ready on the runway the log is spammed with:

    NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at Dynamic_Controls.ModuleDynamicDeflection.FixedUpdate () [0x00000] in :0 
     
    (Filename:  Line: -1)

Full log etc.:  
[https://www.dropbox.com/s/1udd9rhj8limq46/2017-06-13-1 KSP.log.zip?dl=1](https://www.dropbox.com/s/1udd9rhj8limq46/2017-06-13-1%20KSP.log.zip?dl=1)
[@Crzyrndm](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/92871-crzyrndm/) could only be an empty aeroModule (maybe) or vessel (i don't think so)?
